para: This format supports the .sdf files from the Suunto product family 'Suunto Trek Manager', 'Suunto Ski Manager' and 'Suunto Sail Manager'. The contents of the sdf file depends on the used product and can be one route or one track. That's why when you want to use sdf on the output side you have to use the -r OR the -t option. This will tell GPSBabel which type of data should be written.

Currently we can read the following file types:
4 = M9 TrackLog 5 = Route 28 = X9 TrackLog
